snippet: A tentative plan by Prime Minister Matteo Renzi that could roll back some worker protections has drawn tens of thousands to the streets.
abstract: Tens of thousands of demonstrators gather in Italian cities to protest plan by Prime Min Matteo Renzi to roll back some worker protections; lawmakers are considering proposals to water down plan, known as the Jobs Act, which had already been criticized by economists as inadequate to address economic problems.
lead_paragraph: A tentative plan by Prime Minister Matteo Renzi that could roll back some worker protections has drawn tens of thousands to the streets.

headline.main: In Test for Premier, Italians Rally Against Plan to Relax Labor Rules
headline.print_headline: In Test for Premier, Italians Rally Against Plan to Relax Labor Rules
